body: This caused some compiler errors, fix: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/368
LGTM overall, just two clarification questions.

@Parth-Brahmbhatt : @hachikuji mentioned this. In https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-11+-+Authorization+Interface, it says that we need describe on topic in order to issue GroupMetadataRequest. However, in the code, we check read permission on group. Neither seems accurate. It seems that we need to check describe permission on group?
@hachikuji that should work for now. Is my understanding correct we will have to revisit this after KAFKA-2017 gets in.

Thanks for the contribution. A few points:
- Can you please include a test?
- Why not call it `PASSWORD` instead of `PASSWORD_STRING`?
- Have you tested it? I think you need to override the value, not the type.
LGTM, thanks.

I'm merging this and we can resolve the argparse4j vs jopt later. This patch does not add new inconsistencies.

Thanks for the patch. Just one comment. In Login, we made the kafka-kerberos-refresh-thread a daemon thread. This means that we don't need to explicitly wait for it to shut down. However, it seems that LoginManager.release() still calls Login.shutdown() which waits for kafka-kerberos-refresh-thread to finish?

Sorry, we can't merge. There is a conflict on producer_performance.py.

Also, you mentioned this covers https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/359. However, in JaasUtils, we still reset Configuration to null in isZkSecurityEnabled()?
My change in #359 was just for the SASL part, so I moved it here. I left the ZK part alone as I didn't want to affect Flavio's work.

Ok, it seems we can leave Login.shutdown() as it is. With kafka-kerberos-refresh-thread as a daemon thred, If the consumer client forgets to call close, then we can still shut down jvm.

Thanks for the patch. LGTM.
@junrao I've pushed a fix for your last comment. Thanks for reviewing it.

@fpj It feels slightly confusing to have a command line argument which is quietly ignored when the system property is set. If you have no objection, I will remove the argument. Otherwise, as @ijuma has pointed out, I can still assume in `JaasUtils` that the configuration is obtained from the system property since it is being set in `ZkSecurityMigrator`.
LGTM
Sorry @rajinisivaram, can you please merge trunk as there are now conflicts?
I think we all agree that the argument can be removed.

@rajinisivaram I don't object to removing the argument, but help me understand what is confusing about it. Are you concerned about configuration errors due to the two ways of setting it? If you could explain the scenario you're worried about, I'd appreciate.

> command line argument which is quietly ignored 

I wouldn't say that the command-line argument is ignored, instead it has lower precedence, so you need to set at least one. 

> the system property is overridden by an option

Maybe this comment is stale at this point, but we currently don't really override when the system property is set. If the system property is set, then the command-line option is ignored.
Thanks, LGTM.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM

@fpj At the moment if you have an environment variable KAFKA_OPTS set which specifies a Jaas config file using the system property (as we do), and the migration tool is run using kafka-run-class.sh, the command line argument to specify the config file is ignored. It doesn't give any warnings or errors and you need to go and look into docs/code to figure out why the command line arg was not used. It can be easily fixed with a warning, so not necessarily a big issue.

I was going to submit an updated PR, but the tests added today for ZK auth are failing intermittently. I think it is related to the reloading of `Configuration` in tests. I will wait until that is fixed before updating this.
@jjkoshy I think the updated the patch should address the concern raised by you and Onur. Thanks!

@gwenshap I need to fill out some unit tests for the new functionality in the Herders, but figured you might want start taking a look at this. System test included. Note that currently it'll fail rat checks because trunk has a file missing a copyright, you can merge w/ #377 to fix that.

@junrao Yes originally I proposed to have Describe for Group but I think Jay suggested in one of KIP meetings to just go with Read for groups. Don't remember if it was Jay or someone else. If you think we need to have Describe for Group I can change it back to that, I leave the decision up to you.

@gwenshap updated PR

For example VerifiableProducer uses the names like "--max--messages" and  ProducerPerformance uses the names like "--num-records",  "--record-size".etc.. I have not changed these names..  If required, I will change.

2. Also, ConfigDef.toHtmlTable() seems to have a bug. The doc says first sort by required (which is correct), but it's actually sorting by hasDefault. Could you fix it in this patch too?

Ping @hachikuji @junrao @onurkaraman for reviews.

Major changes:
1. The offset topic message has three versions. 0 and 1 refer to offset message, and 2 refers to group metadata message.
2. Group metadata message contains the selected protocol only, with the subscription and assignment stored as byte arrays. Hence after loading each member will only have the single selected protocol stored, and future join-group requests will multiple supported protocols will be considered as new join requests.
3. When loading the topic from log upon `becomeLeader`, the background thread goes through the message, and based on the key read from the log decided to choose different manner for reading the value (offset or group metadata), and pushing them to respective caches.
4. Metadata cache depend on the underlying `Pool` for concurrent access, while offset cache has two separate locks for "range access''. One is for expiring old offsets from the scheduler thread, the other one is for clearing the cache entries upon `becomeFollower`. Offset fetches will only be guarded by the clearing cache lock. This is basically the same as the old `OffsetManager`.
5. Upon finishing the sync phase, coordinator writes the single-message into the replica manager with the ack mode, and triggers `propogateAssignment` upon completing write.
6. Coordinator check "partition loading in progress" while handling Join / Leave / OffsetCommit / OffsetFetch (we do not check upon Sync and HB), and client handle this error code as retry / ignore / retry / retry.

@granders LGTM to solve the immediate issue. More generally, `*.properties` won't work forever. It seems to me the real thing we're trying to capture here is that we want to include all files under `templates/` directories. Is it possible to express that in `recursive-include`'s syntax.
Thanks for the patch. Since this is a relatively large patch and we are getting really close to cut the 0.9.0 release, perhaps we should defer committing this patch until the 0.9.0 branch is cut.
awesomeness! LGTM.

Updated to target files underneath `templates` directories
Tested with `check-manifest` tool, and by running a few confluent system tests which depend on `kafkatest` package

Note that Jenkins test is still failing due to merge errors.

I also think there's a leftover "<<< HEAD" in there, may be related.

@gwenshap yes, the arguments are of the form "num-records" ,"record-size".  "-" has special meaning in  argparse4j. So while defining arguments, we need to give unique name  and we can use this unique name to read the arguments .
My bad. I was again going to say LGTM but noticed that your change makes kafka-clients depend on yammer metrics, which I think we wanted to avoid.

[~junrao] We were hoping that SASL/PLAIN could be supported in 0.9.0.0. Most of the changes in the patch are to enable testing. While it would be good to have a default PLAIN provider integrated into Kafka, that is not critical for us. If I split this into two PRs, one to add the ability to plugin a PLAIN provider and the second to add a default provider plus tests, can the first one be committed into 0.9.0.0? That should be a much small patch. Thank you...
@Mszak, are you still working on this? To have any chance of this making it to 0.9.0.0, we'd need a PR that is ready for review ASAP (even then there is no guarantee).
Yes, I have just firstly misunderstood what you meant in the issue description. I will try to do this till this Sunday, but do my best to finish it earlier.
@junrao @granders Thank you, will rebase and incorporate Geoff's suggestions and try to submit an update later today (will need to rerun all the tests again since trunk has changed quite a lot).

I created new class to store password that overrides toString method. There are many places where passwords are used as String (eg. TestSslUtils.java in createSslConfig()). Should I change all to Password object? For now I added conversion in SslFactory in method configure.
@guozhangwang: is there anything else I need to do?

@rajinisivaram : You need a default PLAIN provider for SASL PLAIN to work, right? Perhaps we can get KAFKA-2644 in first and then revisit this. In the meantime, could you test the patch on system tests?

Given the dependency constraint, I think the best approach would be to have a kafka-metrics-total and yammer-metrics-total.

kafka-metrics-total can get created within Metrics
yammer-metrics-total can get made in KafkaServer on startup

kafka-metrics-total could use `metrics.size()`
yammer-metrics-total could use the `com.yammer.metrics.Metrics.defaultRegistry().groupedMetrics().values()` trick.

@junrao Testing KAFKA-2644 locally at the moment, will deliver later today. For SASL/PLAIN, the default provider is useful for testing, but you can plug in your own provider through your Jaas config and that would work for us. Will let you know when KAFKA-2644 is ready.
LGTM.
Thanks for the patch. LGTM.

A couple of quick comments.
1. MemberMetadata
   Variables such as assignment, awaitingSyncCallback need to be volatile. Basically, if the reader and the writers are in different threads, we need a memory barrier for the reader to see the latest value. Setting a variable as volatile is one way to achieve that.
2. Currently, it seems that we put the group coordinator in the loading mode after the leader changes. It's possible for a broker to get a leaderAndIsr request while it's still the leader of a partition. For example, during controller failover, the new controller will resend leaderAndIsr requests for existing partitions. If the leader doesn't actually change, we don't have to reload the offset data.

@junrao: the current synchronization pattern maintains the invariant that a GroupMetadata is owned by one thread at a time. Any access or modifications to group state (including its members) are guarded by the GroupMetadata's implicit lock. Is this invariant being broken anywhere?
LGTM
I would change the usages to use a Password instance, yes. Otherwise, we could not be sure that the actual password would not be printed.

@junrao Ping for review. A few comments:
1. DescribeGroup in this initial patch only accepts one groupId. Should be straightforward to modify it to accept and return an array instead.
2. I haven't done so yet, but I think it would make sense to rename GroupMetadataRequest to GroupCoordinatorRequest.
3. I included an AdminClient to help with integration testing. This doesn't necessarily need to be included in this patch, but it seems like we'll need this functionality to implement ConsumerGroupCommand for the new consumer.
Agree that we should prevent running 3rd party code in the DistributedHerder's worker thread. Do you want to open a JIRA so we won't lose that todo?
Yup, filed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-2713 to track it.
Merged with the changes in trunk and removed SASL in all benchmark tests except end-to-end latency.
